item.title: The How and Why of 10 Gbps WAN Bandwidth
item.description:
By: John Shepler The volume of data continues to expand. HD video is on the verge of being replaced by 4K and eventually 8K video. As applications transition to the cloud, IT data centers are progressively shutting down. The question arises: where will the bandwidth originate to accommodate the increasing bit rates required in the MAN and WAN? This bandwidth is being supplied by fiber optic carriers who understand that every organization must increase its data capacity to remain competitive...

item.title: Wavelength Services For The Enterprise
item.description:
Initially only utilized by telecom companies, wavelength services are now accessible to large organizations. These high-bandwidth fiber optic services are necessary for entities like hospitals, financial institutions, government service providers, video production companies, content delivery networks, and research facilities. The demand for faster data transfer solutions is constantly increasing. But are wavelength services the answer? A wavelength, or lambda, is light at a specific frequency, similar to a distinct color. item.title: Gigabit Connection Services
item.description:

In such locations, even medium-sized businesses may find 1,000 Mbps connectivity affordable. So, who needs Gigabit bandwidth? Telecom providers with nationwide fiber optic networks, for one.
